page.title: 10House renovating -Chillerton
page.content: {Alex Arnell writes -}In 1979 we bought Hill House for Â£13000. It had two bed- rooms above two living rooms and had a chemical closet in a small garden shed It had mains electricity and rate-free water. An old range was used for the cooking and heating. A wash house held a cast-iron tub with fireplace beneath {We built an extension}- lounge, 2 bed- rooms, bathroom, shower-room, integral garage. We renovated existing rooms and equipped the kitchen with electric cooker, dishwasher, 'frig and freezer, and washing machine. One of our two wood-burning stoves heats water and there is oil-fired central heating. Walls, loft and under-floor are all insulated. Today the house is worth Â£50,000-Â£60,000. The extension cost us approx. Â£20,000 but it would have cost considerably more if we had not done most of the work ourselves.
